page.title: 01Rural Glos.the village scene
page.content: The villages are set below the wooded Limestone ridge of the Cotswold Hills. The highest local point being 778' at Frocester Hill. The attractive rural countryside is sparsely populated with ten farms of 200-250 acres plus smaller units as part of larger farms.Fields are mainly intensively managed grass for Dairying with some arable crops and permanent pasture on the hilland.Soil is fertile on Severn Terrace Gravel or Lias Clay. The higher land is lighter and more cereals are grown. Dutch Elm Disease destroyed the Elms leaving Ash and Oak,but regeneration of Elm has taken place.Farmers with an eye to conservation have planted woods and new hedges!Few orchards remain. Population:Frocester 172 Coaley 900. Archaeology,Agriculture,Village Life & Ecology are topics discussed.
